message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

This paper deals with learning representations of video sequences using deep learning techniques, specifically multilayer Long Short Term Memory (LSTM) networks. The paper explores different design choices and evaluates the representations by finetuning them for a supervised learning problem - human action recognition on the UCF-101 and HMDB-51 datasets. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also deals with unsupervised learning and deep learning techniques, which makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories. The paper also deals with multimedia and video processing, which makes cs.MM (Multimedia) a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper uses LSTMs, which are a type of recurrent neural network, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category as well.
